Name: Create Foundational Knowledge Assets
Documentation: End-to-end stream to generate, validate, and publish new scholarly knowledge for reuse and societal impact.

Name: Formulate Research Question
Documentation: Define a clear, impactful, and testable research question grounded in evidence and gaps.

Name: Design Study
Documentation: Plan methodology, protocols, instruments, and compliance to answer the research question.

Name: Acquire Data
Documentation: Collect or source data ethically and reliably according to the study design.

Name: Analyze Data
Documentation: Process, model, and interpret data to generate defensible findings.

Name: Author and Submit Manuscript
Documentation: Draft, format, and submit manuscripts to appropriate venues.

Name: Peer Review and Revise
Documentation: Address reviewer feedback and refine content to meet publication standards.

Name: Publish and Disseminate
Documentation: Publish outputs and disseminate through repositories and channels for broad access.

Name: Design Academic Programs & Courses
Documentation: Stream to architect, validate, and maintain programs and courses ready for delivery.

Name: Define Program Outcomes
Documentation: Specify measurable learning outcomes aligned to competencies and market needs.

Name: Architect Curriculum
Documentation: Structure courses, sequences, and credits to achieve program outcomes.

Name: Develop Course Materials
Documentation: Author and assemble syllabi, content, assessments, and teaching guides.

Name: Validate and Approve Program
Documentation: Secure governance, accreditation, and quality approvals for launch.

Name: Refresh and Sunset Content
Documentation: Continuously update, version, and retire content to ensure currency.

Name: Deliver Personalized Learning Journeys
Documentation: Stream to attract, educate, assess, and credential learners with tailored experiences.

Name: Attract and Advise Learner
Documentation: Engage prospects and guide pathway choices based on goals and readiness.

Name: Admit and Enroll Learner
Documentation: Process applications, decisions, registration, and onboarding.

Name: Deliver Instruction
Documentation: Facilitate teaching and learning interactions across modalities.

Name: Assess Learning
Documentation: Evaluate knowledge, skills, and competencies with valid measures.

Name: Credential and Graduate
Documentation: Confirm requirements, confer credentials, and record attainment.

Name: Place and Engage Alumni
Documentation: Support career placement and sustain alumni relationships and contributions.

Name: Conduct Sponsored Research Engagements
Documentation: Stream to win, execute, and close sponsored projects delivering agreed outcomes.

Name: Identify Opportunity
Documentation: Scan and qualify sponsor needs and alignment opportunities.

Name: Shape and Submit Proposal
Documentation: Develop scope, budget, and plan; submit compliant proposals.

Name: Negotiate Scope and Terms
Documentation: Finalize scope, IP, compliance, and commercial terms with sponsors.

Name: Execute Project
Documentation: Manage tasks, resources, and risks to deliver project scope.

Name: Deliver Results and IP
Documentation: Provide deliverables, data, and IP per contractual obligations.

Name: Closeout and Report
Documentation: Complete financial, compliance, and technical closeout reporting.

Name: Commercialize Research Outputs
Documentation: Stream to translate research into licenses or ventures that reach markets.

Name: Scout and Disclose Inventions
Documentation: Identify innovations and submit formal disclosures.

Name: Protect Intellectual Property
Documentation: Secure IP through filings and prosecution strategies.

Name: Evaluate Market Potential
Documentation: Assess market size, fit, and commercialization pathways.

Name: Execute Licensing or Venture Formation
Documentation: Negotiate licenses or form startups to commercialize IP.

Name: Support Venture/IP Scale-Up
Documentation: Enable growth with mentoring, funding access, and partnerships.

Name: Knowledge Asset Creation
Documentation: Organizational ability to produce, validate, and publish scholarly knowledge assets.

Name: Research Question Formulation
Documentation: Capability to identify gaps and craft testable, impactful research questions.

Name: Study Protocol Design
Documentation: Capability to design rigorous, compliant research protocols and instruments.

Name: Research Data Acquisition
Documentation: Capability to obtain high-quality, ethical, and reliable research data.

Name: Data Analysis
Documentation: Capability to analyze data and derive valid insights and conclusions.

Name: Manuscript Authoring
Documentation: Capability to author, format, and submit scholarly manuscripts.

Name: Peer Review Response
Documentation: Capability to manage reviews, revise content, and resubmit effectively.

Name: Publication & Repository Deposit
Documentation: Capability to publish outputs and deposit artifacts in repositories.

Name: Academic Program Engineering
Documentation: Ability to design, govern, and sustain academic programs and courses.

Name: Program Outcome Definition
Documentation: Capability to define measurable, accredited-aligned learning outcomes.

Name: Curriculum Architecture
Documentation: Capability to structure curricula, sequences, credits, and prerequisites.

Name: Course Material Authoring
Documentation: Capability to create high-quality instructional materials and assessments.

Name: Program Validation & Approval
Documentation: Capability to achieve internal and external approvals and accreditation.

Name: Content Refresh & Sunsetting
Documentation: Capability to update and retire content through controlled lifecycle.

Name: Learning Experience Delivery
Documentation: Ability to attract, enroll, teach, assess, and graduate learners.

Name: Learner Advising
Documentation: Capability to counsel learners on pathways and supports.

Name: Admission & Enrollment Processing
Documentation: Capability to process applications, decisions, registration, and onboarding.

Name: Instruction Facilitation
Documentation: Capability to deliver effective teaching across modalities.

Name: Assessment Administration
Documentation: Capability to design, deliver, and grade assessments with integrity.

Name: Credential Issuance
Documentation: Capability to verify completion and issue official credentials.

Name: Alumni Engagement & Placement
Documentation: Capability to support placement and maintain alumni relationships.

Name: Sponsored Research Delivery
Documentation: Ability to acquire, execute, and close sponsored research projects.

Name: Opportunity Identification
Documentation: Capability to discover and qualify sponsor-aligned opportunities.

Name: Proposal Development
Documentation: Capability to plan, budget, and submit competitive proposals.

Name: Scope & Terms Negotiation
Documentation: Capability to negotiate scope, IP, and commercial terms.

Name: Sponsored Research Execution
Documentation: Capability to manage delivery, risks, and compliance for projects.

Name: Results & IP Delivery
Documentation: Capability to produce deliverables, data, and IP per agreements.

Name: Project Closeout
Documentation: Capability to complete financial, compliance, and technical closeout.

Name: Innovation & IP Translation
Documentation: Ability to protect, license, and scale research-derived innovations.

Name: Invention Scouting & Disclosure
Documentation: Capability to identify innovations and file formal disclosures.

Name: Patent Filing & Prosecution
Documentation: Capability to secure IP through patent strategy and actions.

Name: Market Potential Evaluation
Documentation: Capability to assess market attractiveness and commercialization routes.

Name: Licensing Execution
Documentation: Capability to structure and negotiate licensing agreements.

Name: Venture Scale-Up Support
Documentation: Capability to enable startup growth via resources and networks.

Name: Knowledge Asset
Documentation: Published scholarly artifact or dataset intended for reuse and citation.

Name: Research Question
Documentation: Statement of the problem or hypothesis under investigation.

Name: Study Protocol
Documentation: Documented methodology, procedures, and instruments for research.

Name: Research Data
Documentation: Collected data sets produced or sourced during the study.

Name: Analytical Results
Documentation: Derived results, models, or findings from data analysis.

Name: Manuscript
Documentation: Authored scholarly paper prepared for submission or publication.

Name: Revision Package
Documentation: Compiled responses and changes addressing peer review.

Name: Published Output
Documentation: Final published article, dataset, or repository record.

Name: Academic Program Asset
Documentation: Definition artifacts that specify and govern academic offerings.

Name: Program Outcomes
Documentation: Target competencies and achievements for graduates.

Name: Curriculum Blueprint
Documentation: Structured plan of courses, sequences, and credit design.

Name: Course Materials
Documentation: Instructional content, assessments, and teaching guides.

Name: Program Validation Package
Documentation: Evidence and documentation for program approval.

Name: Content Lifecycle Plan
Documentation: Plan for versioning, updates, and retirement of materials.

Name: Learning Delivery Record
Documentation: Artifacts documenting learner engagement and achievement.

Name: Advising Plan
Documentation: Personalized academic plan and guidance notes.

Name: Enrollment Record
Documentation: Official record of admissions, registration, and status.

Name: Delivered Instruction Session
Documentation: Record of instructional sessions delivered to learners.

Name: Assessment Attempt
Documentation: Submission and results for a specific assessment instance.

Name: Credential
Documentation: Official recognition of completed learning and attainment.

Name: Alumni Engagement Profile
Documentation: Ongoing profile of alumni activities and outcomes.

Name: Sponsored Research Engagement Artifact
Documentation: Contractual and technical records of sponsored projects.

Name: Opportunity Brief
Documentation: Summary of sponsor needs and research opportunity fit.

Name: Proposal
Documentation: Formal offer detailing scope, budget, and approach.

Name: Research Agreement
Documentation: Executed contract setting terms, IP, and obligations.

Name: Sponsored Research Output
Documentation: Results, prototypes, or datasets produced in the project.

Name: Sponsor Deliverable
Documentation: Contracted deliverables supplied to the sponsor.

Name: Closeout Package
Documentation: Final technical, financial, and compliance documentation.

Name: Innovation & Commercialization Artifact
Documentation: Artifacts used to protect, license, and grow innovations.

Name: Invention Disclosure
Documentation: Filed description of a new invention or discovery.

Name: Patent Application
Documentation: Application filed to obtain legal IP protection.

Name: Market Evaluation Report
Documentation: Analysis of market size, demand, and competitive landscape.

Name: License Agreement
Documentation: Contract granting rights to use IP under defined terms.

Name: Venture Scale-Up Plan
Documentation: Plan outlining growth milestones, resources, and risks.
